entry.def: The likelihood of something happening is how likely it is to happen.

example.ex: The likelihood of infection is minimal...
There didn't seem much likelihood of it happening...
example.tran: 这种事情发生的可能性不大。

entry.def: If something is a likelihood, it is likely to happen.

example.ex: But the likelihood is that people would be willing to pay if they were certain that their money was going to a good cause...
example.tran: 但如果人们确切知道自己的钱会用于做善事，他们就可能更愿意掏腰包。

example.ex: That, as we all know, is not only a possibility but a likelihood.
example.tran: 众所周知，那不仅可能发生，而且是很可能发生。

entry.def: If you say that something will happen in all likelihood, you mean that it will probably happen.

example.ex: In all likelihood, the committee will have to interview every woman who's worked with Thomas.
example.tran: 十有八九，委员会将不得不与每一位曾和托马斯共过事的女性面谈。

means.word_mean: 1. the probability of a specified outcome

stems_affixes.type_exp: 表名词,多加在名词后,"时期,性质"等

stems_affixes.word_buile: bachelor单身汉+hood时期,性质→n.独身,独身生活
boy男孩+hood时期,性质→n.少年时代[期]
child儿童+hood时期,性质→n.幼年,童年
false错误的+hood表示状态→n.错误;撒谎
hardi=hardy勇敢的+hood时期,性质→n.大胆,鲁莽
likeli=likely可能的+hood时期,性质→n.可能性

Sentence.sentence: Several recent studies have found that being randomly (随机地) assigned to a roommate of another race can lead to increased tolerance but also to a greater likelihood (可能性)of conflict.

Smith touches on construction methods, the revolutionary invention of the automatic lift, the practicalities of living in the sky and the likelihood that, as cities become more crowded, apartment living will become the norm.

sentences.en: I don't think there is any likelihood of his agreeing to it.
sentences.cn: 我认为不会有他同意那件事情的可能。

jushi.chinese: 我认为不会有他同意那件事情的可能。

jushi.english: In all likelihood that the meeting will be canceled.
